page.title: 04Landscape in Nibley
page.content: This area of landscape covers part of Cotswold Edge, with scarp slopes and deep valleys leading to the flat open Severn Vale. The majority of the land is rural with a few farms which are situated at the bottom of the valleys. This includes the south west section of Dursley and all of North Nibley. In Woodmancote there are many buildings of historic interest. Several date back to the 17th century. Nibley House is one of these. The house was remodelled and a new front added in 1763. The house is listed and the main attraction is the grand 18th century staircase. Stancombe Park is another listed house. Parts of the house date from 1780 and others from 1850. There are approximately 20 rooms. THe house has 150 acres surrounding it and is owned by Mr. Barlow.
